topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537d9de463687228e82e0000#post_537d9de463687228e82e0000
They still have been gone a while and the habitat where they are from has adapted; other animals have taken their place in the food web and may be living on the places where they would need to live. It's like moving out of your house for a few years then suddenly moving back in after a family has been living there for years.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537d9ea463687228be770000#post_537d9ea463687228be770000
The thylacine was an apex predator. The next biggest thing is the Tasmanian devil. To show the difference, the thylacine could grow up to 1.3 meters long. The average Tasmanian devil is half that size.

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537d9fd26368725731280000#post_537d9fd26368725731280000
The bite of the Brazilian wandering spider causes priapism, also known as a constant, immensely painful erection. The only way to fix it is to drain all of the blood from the penis, this can possibly result in permanent impotence.

That said, I still shrieked like a little girl when I clicked that link.

I am not fond of arthropods in any form, no sir. (Not entirely true, I do like some for being incredibly cool or interesting.)

Yeah, but the safer version wouldn't be "all-natural". It would be based on a natural substance, but it would be a modified version.

Did you know that the insulin that diabetics receive is made in GMO bacteria?

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537da34c63687212495b0000#post_537da34c63687212495b0000
It would be actually; the venom could either be diluted or mixed with something else or the active ingredient could ebe extracted and refined. It's still all natural, just like how cane sugar is all natural, but must be extracted from the plant.
